pullRequest.bodyText:
…nto two flow. Default flow will not create stack entity and this means we only store the template. The other flow will add an original node count and the we dont need to collect instancemetadatas.
See detailed description in the commit message.

beforeCommit.message: CB-9127 refactor the current cluster template logic and separate it into two flow. Default flow will not create stack entity and this means we only store the template. The other flow will add an original node count and the we dont need to collect instancemetadatas.

nodes.bodyText: Do we need this? It is going to break during CB upgrade.
Do we need an IP in the template?
Do we need an Status in the template?
I think we can eliminate a few fields/relations from this entity.

nodes.bodyText: Please correct the message and also log it.

Can we set it to false as it was? As I know it is not a very good idea to use parallal streams in a multithreaded web based application because it can cause high load for one request and the application should be able to serve many request at the same time.
